intro: Rubus ligerinus, commonly known as the New Zealand bramble, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its prickly stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruits, known as raspberries, are edible and have a tart flavor. Rubus ligerinus plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food for various wildlife species.
